intro: Gueldenstaedtia mirpoureana, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, particularly Armenia and Georgia. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Gueldenstaedtia mirpoureana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
